content.title: CHIEF MINISTER EMPLOYMENT GENERATION PROGRAMME (CMEGP)
content.details: Scheme launched by GR शासन निर्णय क्र. योजना-२०१९/प्र.क्र.१२१/उद्योग ७ dated on 01.08.2019. The Scheme will be implemented and monitored by Directorate of Industries (DOI), under the administrative control of Industries Department, Government of Maharashtra. The Scheme will be implemented through District Industries Canters (DICs), Maharashtra State Khadi and Village Industries Boards (KVIB) under the control of Directorate of Industries and also by banks.
benefits: Maximum cost of the project/unit admissible under manufacturing sector is Rs.50 lakh.

Maximum cost of the project/unit admissible under service, Agro-based/ Primary Agro processing sector, E-vehicle based goods transport and other businesses, single brand service ventures is Rs.20 lakhs.
Beneficiary’s Contribution in the project cost will be 5% to 10% as per the Categories of Beneficiaries under CMEGP scheme.
eligibility: Age of the applicant should be between 18 to 45. For Special category, age is relaxed by 5 years.
Occupation of the applicant should be unemployed youth or youth willing to establish new ventures.
Annual Income of the Applicant/Family/Parent/Guardian should have no criteria.
Gender of the applicant should be Male and Female.
Marital Status of the applicant should be for all.
Educational Qualification of the applicant should be minimum 7th standard pass for project/unit above Rs. 10 lac and for project/units above Rs.25 lac, minimum 10th standard pass.
exclusions: Only one person from a family will be eligible under the scheme.
Existing Units and units that have availed benefit under PMRY, REGP, PMEGP or any other subsidy linked scheme of Government of India or State Government are not eligible.
content.application_process: Online. Step 01: Fill online application on portal https://maha-cmegp.gov.in. Step 02: District level Scrutiny and Coordination Sub-Committee (DLSCC) will scrutinize the applications. Step 03: Primary eligible applicants list will be approved by DLTFC and then forwarded to bank. Step 04: Bank Sanctioning & Entrepreneurship Development Programme (EDP) training & Disbursement. Step 05: Subsidy claim by Bank to GM. Step 06: Approval of claim by HO and disbursement of margin money. Step 07: Completion of three successful years of activity and following the timely repayment schedule.
documents_required: Clearance/approved certificate (bank) (If Working capital is zero for project cost more than 5 lac)

faqs.question: What is maximum project cost allowed under CMEGP?
faqs.answer: Rs.50.00 lakhs for manufacturing unit and Rs.20.00 lakhs for Service Unit.

faqs.question: What is Age limit?
faqs.answer: Any individuals between 18 to 45 years of age. For special category age is relaxed by 5 years.

faqs.question: What is the definition of family?
Whether Unit can be set up in urban Area?
What are the main criteria of project?
faqs.answer: It should fulfill the criteria of rural area, own contribution, negative list and the unit should be new.

faqs.question: What is lock in period for Govt. Subsidy?
Which are the financial agencies?
faqs.answer: All Public Sector Banks, Regional Rural Banks (RRB), Co-operative Banks, Private Scheduled Commercial Banks regulated by RBI.

faqs.question: Where does the beneficiary has to submit his/her application/ Project?
faqs.answer: Beneficiary can submit his/her application/Project online on CMEGP website.
